In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can define the function:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    i = 1
    while i <= length(words)
        j = min(i + text_width - 1, length(words))
        join(words[i:j], ' ') * (j < length(words) ? "\n" : "")
        i = j + 1
    end
end
```

Here's an example of how to use the function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce lobortis, risus id viverra auctor"
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet, 
consectetur
adipiscing
elit. Fusce
lobortis, risus
id viverra auctor
```
